A NYC woman tragically died after being struck by a flying solar panel during a nor'easter, while the city is also facing rabies outbreaks, heavy rain forecasts, and ongoing political tensions surrounding mayoral debates and housing reforms.

### Risks & Alerts

- NYC woman killed by flying solar panel during nor'easter. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihgFBVV95cUxORklEZU1OYklkcVk5eFdtVExFeGZBVGdMXzdjN3ROTHJWQzdGR1JkTndjaEFJUm5rUUVfZTBDb1ptNEtHbllYZm01VUMwZ3hGREFqT1ZJY2FJbkdVQ1BiMEhHSURYc2JKNjI1c2Zia1FCWURXZ1BHb2tyaGt0dHZBNWE3M1Z5Zw?oc=5)
- NYC deploying rabies vaccine baits; Staten Island will not receive any despite numerous cases. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Heavy rain and gusty winds expected Sunday night into Monday; prepare for potential disruptions. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Frost advisory issued for NYC as temperatures drop overnight; protect sensitive plants and pets. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Parades and runs will cause NYC road closures the weekend of Oct. 18; plan alternate routes. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
